alert.note: Alert for Hoke; Scotland (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 30 at 12:55PM EDT until April 30 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Hoke and Scotland. * WHEN...Until 400 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1255 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Laurinburg, Raeford, Antioch, Wagram, Gibson, East Laurinburg, Bowmore, Silver City, Camp Mackall, Ashley Heights, Laurel Hill, Sandhills Game Land and Rockfish. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
